Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE PLEASE..... DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY IN THIS HOTEL...”
Reviews.Author: Marafon1975
Reviews.Content: as my title review i say Dont stay here... lets start from reception area very small and the hotel looks old as it really is. the receptionist all of them are very arrogant and always looks they are busy so they cannot talk with you..... i request a very high floor room and i got it but as soon i went inside i was ejected due to VERY VERY STRONG SMELL...... there was a very tiny window no fresh airat all. i request to change the room so they give me room 105 just opposite the reception where all the noise from late evening and early morning we can listen. the hotel charges 2euros per person per day for a Tax called City tax from Rome council. the breakfast is terrible. only 1 type of bread and coffee and milk take ages to came to your table because there is only one person working doing everything including cleaning and serving guests. the coffee and milk came in open jars so the get cold very easy..... the yogurts are hot just placed on top of the breakfast table as normal as a piece of cake. this morning 12 of November 2011 we were at breakfast when a manager came and started a discussion with the only person serving us in a very bad way where everyone could listen that she was telling her off...... was very unpleasant ....... by the way on our first morning here they send us to have breakfast one block way in other hotel called BLEND HOTEL from same owner ...... so be prepared to walk to another hotel to have your poor breakfast if you gave it included....... the bed is good but the pillows are hard like a rocks....... the is a tv on the room 20'inches screen far 5 meters from your bed with 5 channels only........ including one German no a single international news channel...... if you want use wireless is free u can get code from reception. the toilet and bathroom is old and the showers curtain is broken. be careful u can burn yourself with the shower water changing from cold to extra hot in a second...... very very dangerous..... on my window inside there are a smoke on all of it but i just realise is dust from the last 6 to 8 months....... there is no cleaning process here at all..... i will post some pictures later today DON'T SPEND YOUR MONEY TO STAY HERE PLEASE CHOOSE ANOTHER HOTEL THE MONEY YOU SPEND FOR HERE YOU CAN STAY IN A GOOD HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “RUN AWAY FAST!!”
Reviews.Author: Hnharmon
Reviews.Content: This was the worst place I stayed on my entire trip! Want good service, air conditioning, clean rooms without mysterious stains on the wall, showers that don't burn or freeze you to death? Well certainly do not come here because that is exactly what you will get. The receptionist with the lazy eyes acts like you are stupid if you ask him anything and don't expect to get a fan for your hot room unless you tell people in line waiting to check in that they should probably leave because the hotel is gross...which I did muhahaha. Seriously, if you don't have to stay there don't. It was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay there”
Reviews.Author: Luckyluc22
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews and will keep this short the only good thing about this hotel is its 15 minutes from the coloseum the rest forget it. Ants, mold, and to many other things to list. Go live on a bench it would be better... Staff is very rude...3 stars should be changed to a 1 star...do yourself a great favor dont stay there you will live to regret it

Reviews.Title: “don't go here unless you love red ants and black mold on the walls”
Reviews.Author: hippychicklet
Reviews.Content: i booked this for a surprise trip to Rome for my partners 40th birthday and by the pics on the website this looked like a lovely little hotel. From the outside, hotel daniela certainly did look a fab little hotel. once inside the miniscule room though, the picture was completely different, the walls were rotten, wallpaper was torn and there was black mold on the wall right by the bottom of the bed. The bathroom was actually bigger than the room but the shower is awful and looks like the lime scale on ALL the attachments has been breeding for years, you also share it with a little gang of red ants, who like to go on day trips to the bed and bite you on the legs!!!! When I asked for a room change, i was basically told NO, by an extremely arrogant and snotty receptionist. Up until "antgate", I thought i was stuck in this room, but thankfully there was a young man on reception at night who had manners, excellent customer service and deserves a pay rise and praise for his speedy response and organising a room change. This was after 2 days of the room from hell. During the day, don't think of a lie in as housekeeping knocks continuously and then get reception to phone the room. If you say no and don't open the door, it generally means you don't want to be pestered. If you love smart bummed, arrogant receptionists, red ants and black mold, then this is the hotel for you, if not DO NOT book a room with this hotel or any other in its francise.....Leonardi Hotels. Upside, they had a great little map of Rome in the entrance hall!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: MicheMaria
Reviews.Content: We were pretty much afraid prior to checking into Hotel Daniela after reading most of the reviews. We stayed in this hotel for 7 days. Our hotel room had excellent air conditioning, a newly remodeled bathroom, and great views. You get what you pay for as far as the beds go. They are hard as a rock. The breakfast itself was average but the service was excellent. We never had problems with having our belongings stolen. The street where the hotel is located is very quiet. However the area itself seems a little sketchy during the evening hours. That would be our only reason not to use this hotel in the future. The hotel is within five minutes walking distance to Manzoni metro station which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bmrock
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a group from my college for a study abroad program. This hotel is supposedly a "3 star" hotel...I wouldn't even give it one star. When we arrived, our room had three beds in a tiny space and was extremely hot inside. When we tried to turn on the air conditioner, it only blew out warm air. We asked the staff to come look at it and he laughed (like he knew it was broken) and said he knew what was wrong and told us someone would come the next morning to look at it. So, the next day we asked again and they said these things "take time". Ok, whatever. We went out for the day and then came back that night and asked about it again. They told us someone would have to come out the next day to put the freon in it and so we asked for a fan because it was miserably hot. The guy called someone and then told us they had none. The next day, we asked again...and were told they couldn't help us. After getting angry and asking for a fan again or a different room, the guy got on the phone to call someone again. While he was on the phone, a few people came in behind us to check in. We told them how horrible the service was and how no one seemed to care enough to help us out. We did this in front of the desk staff who was on the phone, and miraculously they have a fan for us now. So we stayed there 3 nights and they never even tried to help us out at all. In addition to that, our shower water was either ice cold or scalding hot, there was no in-between. And there were cockroaches in the hallways. I would NEVER stay at this place again and would not recommend it to anyone!! Had I not been with the group, I would have demanded a refund and stayed somewhere else. They were the most rude and uncaring people I've ever met!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Reasonably Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: independencecity
Reviews.Content: My friend and I ended up at this hotel unexpectedly. The hotel we booked moved us here with the excuse that they were having electrical problems. We were initially unhappy because the location was not as convenient and the hotel didn't seem as nice as the one we booked. The rooms were small but well kept. We had a problem with the drainage of our shower which they fixed when we informed the staff. I thought we got a pretty good value for what we paid. What really made this a pleasant stay was the staff. What was initially an unhappy circumstance for us turned out to be quite positive because the staff was friendly, helpful, informative and accommodating. I would say that the facilities are average but the staff bumped that rating up to a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel - Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: TomJacobs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 20 minutes from the main train station in a questionable but safe area of Rome. Reception staff show an exuberant amount of arrogance bordering being downright obnoxious.The hotel is in need of some TLC but overall we found it to be basic yet clean, unlike the streets of Rome, that are dirty. Room had air-co and in July that is a gift when in Rome. It took 10-15 minutes before the water would somewhat heat up for a nice refreshing shower. The breakfast is decent and for the price you pay one shouldn't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Good room at cheap prices”
Reviews.Author: priyadarshi
Reviews.Content: Good room and helpful staff. Cheap for the city, and good for solo travellers. However, a lil distance off the main city, and would require 10 mins walk to the nearest train connection. Silent cozy place.

Reviews.Title: “Old School European Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: whytelightnin2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights when we were stranded due to the Icelandic volcano, and we couldn't get a reservation at the hotel in Rome where we stayed previously. This is what you used to expect of a European budget hotel: old building that has seen better days, small, dark, dreary rooms, questionable plumbing... The room itself wasn't too bad. Drab decor, creepy iconography, rock-hard bed, and paper thin pillows, but other than that, it was serviceable. It seemed like the place was very short-staffed in the cleaning department. The same dead cockroach that was in the hallway when we checked in was still there two days later when we checked out. The thing that really bothered me was the water. It smelled of sulphur and the stench permeated the bathroom all the time. The shower also only dispensed either scalding or freezing water. No internet access in this hotel for guests, and no TV channels in English, which normally wouldn't bother me at all, but since we were stranded, I wanted to keep updated on the volcano situation. Fortunately I understand French and was able to tune into a Swiss news channel. The hotel location is near the Manzoni stop on the metro, about a twenty minute walk from Termini. Not a bad area, but not much in the way of restaurants. We paid 80 euro a night, but there are better places to stay for that price in Rome. Avoid this one if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Try to find another hotel; Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: SomebodyTehran
Reviews.Content: - TV was not working in all the rooms for our whole stay and no one was responsible for that! - The English knowledge of the reception was so little - It is 15 minutes far from metro station - It is 10 minutes far from bus station - Breakfast choices are limited

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: montyLancs
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not act as a 3 star more a 1 star. The man at the reception was rude. We were with a group of elderly people and I watched as the man at Reception watched an old woman with 2 sticks struggling with her case. when the room keys were given out no one was told which block they were in which caused so much confusion and fuss. One elderly lady who's door was locked was robbed during the night while she was in bed. Reception would not ring the police to help as it said it was our problem. Even asking directions to the police station was enough to send you over the edge as a map was thrown at us. Breakfast was awful and so were the packed lunches. Rooms clean but small. I travel a lot and have never complained about a hotel ever so take my advise look for a better hotel or bring a padlock with you for your room door

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: traveltwino
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and were quite unhappy. Staff was pleasant, but not at all helpful. Room was robbed while locked. Deskman just shrugged when we reported it. Hotel is quite far from sites and does have lovely roof top terraces, but rooms were small and bug infested and none of the linens were changed during our entire stay. It was not a hotel I would ever want to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel, Bad Service, Not Recommended to Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: thatsamore13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely horrible. We stayed here for 4 nights and completely regret choosing this hotel. Our friends were robbed twice! In there hotel room! Once while they were sleeping and once while they werent in their room. The staff was not friendly or helpful. The breakfast was okay. However we saw them filling up the water they serve you from the hose on the side of the hotel. Locks do not work well. Plus you need a key lock the door at night. The location is way out of the way. In the rooms the showers take a long time to get to the any warm. And you can either have a really hot or a really cold shower. Also many of us had an ant infestation in our rooms and in our showers. This was very unpleasant. I absolutely DO NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sslazio9
Reviews.Content: Quick two night stay, Daughters first visit to Rome (nine y.o.). Had booked Bled but led around corner to Daniela. Room dark and cold. Had to leave early on leaving day (seven) no breakfast available. Realised at Termini camera left in room. Phoned desk, and receptionist (man) said ring back in 5 minutes. Duly did and said no camera ?!; [Integrity questioned here. Precious memories gone. Won,t return. Expected more for 70 pounds a night, sorry Bled not again.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed while we were sleeping!”
Reviews.Author: CHERYLEECA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The room had an odor. The day clerk was very rude. We asked for extra towels and never got them. Clerk comment, "We can't drop everything just to help you". Drinking glasses dirty. Breakfast served stale food. Bed was dilapidated. Limited air conditioning. Had to run the water for 20 minutes before it got warm. Red spots on walls. Location is in a questionable area. No deadbolts on the door. During the last night of our stay, someone entered our room between 12:30 and 5:00 in the morning - while we were sleeping! Camera, jewlery, money and purse was stolen. The room next to us was also robbed of their jewelry and money. The police think we were probably drugged, which is why none of us awoke during the robberies. The hotel staff was not helpful. We reported it to the manager before leaving, and none of her staff reported to her that there were robberies or that the police had been there. This hotel is a disaster. Avoid it at all costs. And never stay at a hotel without a deadbolt on your door!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Numptette
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week. It was ok. The rooms are quite spacious and clean. The location is a little out of town. But you get what you pay for. The free continental breakfast was superb. Its just a run of the mill hotel. The staff were polite.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I did not researched properly for this hotel. :-( This place is below average for tourists. How to reach at hotel is confusing. It says 3 min walk. But it is around 3 KM from termini station. Take a taxi or get on metro. The staff is just is as rude and unhelping either. The rooms are small. Our shower pipe was leaking and flow from shower was almost nothing. We complaint this and the staff told that afterall some water is coming and it is sufficient for the need. In a sense we should manage with that. Also that they were aware of the problems beforehand but not willing to fix that. After some heated discussion they agreed to fix that. We moved for touring the rome. We came back quite late only to find that we still cannot take a bath as it is still not fixed. I talked with the staff and they told me that person at earlier shift did not told him about that. They told me that this will get fixed in the morning. We managed somehow with GLASSES and TAP WATER. Shower was not fixed next day also. Thankfully our stay was over next day. The lady at the breakfast table was not a person whom you want to meet for your Good Morning. But next day another lady was serving the breakfast who was more polite than earlier one. I would say if you are planning for stay here, GOOD LUCK & BEST WISHES. Do yourself a favour, Research thoroughly and choose better place. I didn't go through all the reviews at tripadvisor.com. Did I mentioned that place is out of center and coming too late is not a good idea. Taxi driver are always trying to cheat you. Buy a decent map from any book shop at termini and depend on the bus and metro. 3 day pass is very good deal.. Even after this ROME is great city. Don't miss the great city.

Reviews.Title: “recommended budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for two nights in mid July,on arrival the reception staff were very polite and helpful and spoke perfect english. The room was perfectly large enough for both of us,after all you are only going to sleep there,and was spotlessly clean. The bathroom was comparable with most hotel bathrooms we have used over the years and also spotless with no plumbing problems whatever! We walked from the hotel to the Colisseum and the Forum Romano in about twenty minutes, the walk is flat and very easy going (we are both in our mid fifties and reasonably fit) The Vatican is a 10 euro taxi ride away, not a problem for most folks,and there is a very good and reasonably priced restaraunt 5 mins walk away the hotel concierge will supply info on request. All in all an ideal place to stay as long as your expectations are realistic based on the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel in February 2005. We booked it through an internet package deal and only read the reviews on this page after we had paid. Suffice it to say I was extremely concerned and apprehensive. I got the surprise of my life when we arrived and we had a large, clean, quiet room. The bathroom was certainly not the worst I have seen in a three star hotel, yes the showers are old but they are powerful enough to do the job. The area the hotel is in is supposed to be dodgy but we walked into the city and back both nights and we saw nothing at all to cause us any concern and we didn't feel threatened in any way. It is close to a tube station and like a previous review said it is only a 15 minute walk to the colliseum. I recommend walking everywhere as we did mostly and we saw some lovely sights we would have missed by just getting the tube to places all the time. It is fair to say you get what you pay for and as long as you don't expect a palace you shouldn't be disappointed. BTW we didn't try breakfast so cannot comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “very small room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February 2005 for 1 night. I had a room booked in Hotel Bled in the next building for 4 nights but for some reason they put in Daniela for the first night. The single room at the top floor was so minimally little that I couldn't open my suitcase on the floor! The walls were so thin that I woke up in the middle of the night because a person in the next room snored! There were people sleeping on the street right next to the hotel! There was no information on the hotel and services whatsoever in the room. The breakfast was good, though, better than in Hotel Bled!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel - great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Daniela for 10 nights last summer and I find it really bizarre reading the reviews here. We had a brilliant time and found the hotel to be fantastic. The rooms were spacious, cleaned daily, with lovely fresh bed linen and the bed itself was extremely comfortable. As for the location, the hotel is on a quiet street near to some fabulous traditional Italian restaurants. It is within walking distance to the Colosseum (15 mins) and other attractions in that area. Also within walking distance is San Lorenzo with it's great restaurants. We walked to most places, and had we visited during a cooler time of year (instead of August - hottest time of year - during a heat wave) we would have been able to walk to the majority of the main attractions. There is also the tube which is cheap and convenient if you prefer not to walk.

Reviews.Title: “not a three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: horrible, horrible, horrible. This could be the worst hotel I have ever visited. The people at the front desk are extremely rude and not helpful. The beds extremely uncomfortable and the walls paper thin. We could hear everything that was going on in rooms around us, even people couging, sneezing, talking, etc. This is definately NOT a 3 star hotel by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen camera and phone - stay away”
Reviews.Author: martinsfsu
Reviews.Content: Generally, I found the hotel clean and nice. The area is not as bad as some of the reviews have stated and the hotel staff is fairly nice. I visited during the off season in January. However, I must warn potential guests that my digital camera and cell phone were stolen from my room within one day of checking in. The total amount lost is about $500. I notified various people working the front desk, but there was little they could do. There for, I find the security and safety at this hotel questionable, and would warn people to book a room elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Be realistic...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK...we stayed here during the Easter season 2003. This was a high tourist time of year. A couple of things you have to remember when you travel in Europe...rooms are small, pipes are old, Europeans are not as clean as most Americans. For the gentleman who had the pipe noise, you should have known this. In winter time, when old pipes heat up, they make noise. Not sure why you were so surprised. Clearly Hotel Daniela is a smaller older hotel. I think they could have cleaned more thoroughly. My biggest issue is the beds. The rooms are small so I understand that the beds aren't the largest, but it's is time to invest in newer mattresses and newer linens. Aside from that, it is in a quiet part of town, a bit far to walk to the main tourist sights, but the front desk was happy to call us a taxi every morning. We walked home most nights without incident. Or we would take a taxi. It's not in a bad location...in fact, it's fairly close to Santa Maria Maggiore. Since we were rarely in the hotel except to sleelp, I'd say it served it's purpose...not extremely well since the beds are my main complaint...but I didn't really expect glamour since I wasn't in a 4 or 5 star hotel. You just have to be realistic when you travel in Europe. You have maps...you know where you are staying and you know if you stay in a 3 star hotel, it's chancy. 2 you know is bad and 4 you know is good. 3 is the iffy number. Would I stay here again, probably not, but I wasn't surprised. You just have to remember to be realistic.

Reviews.Title: “stay away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Daniela was horrible! We got a good package deal with Expedia for hotel and airfare, so we went with it without knowing. It's in a not-so-nice area of town... bums sleeping on the street... a little isolated and out of the way, very dirty. We had a terrifying walk home at night -- something I wouldn't recommend -- with people following us, no streelights, etc., and this is coming from someone who's been to New York city alone. The staff was extremely rude to us. We went in Nov. 02 also, and there was NO phone service in our rooms. The second day at breakfast there was a cockroach on the table next to us. The last day they lost our key, which you're required to hand in when coming and going (common in Europe) and gave us an extra but refused to give us a different room and claimed they were sure the maid had it. Luckily our things were still in the room and we were able to pile furniture in front of the door that night, our last in Rome and at that hotel, thankfully.

Reviews.Title: “Would not come back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Daniela is on a quiet, tree-lined, residential street and we felt very safe. The room was small and neat. If you can get passed the mildew smell coming from the bathroom, stay here.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Daniela
HotelInfo.Address: Via Luzzatti 31, 00185 Rome, Italy
